title: Here is what people really mean when they say damage is too high.
body:
What they really mean is that there is FAR too much gold given out. This is a screen cap from 15 minutes into a championship match in season 1. 

https://youtu.be/B6UsGUcJVQQ?t=1132

Notice that not a single person has a completed item. These days at 15 minutes people are sitting on 1.5 completed items. Notice that support builds? Supported used to function on around 30-40% of the gold income of a laner. Now they run at about 80%. That's why you see stuff like support brand being able to 1v1 an ADC and generally win. Season 1 support couldn't 1v1 an afk guy. They were SUPPORTS. They SUPPORTED their team.

THIS is what we miss Riot. THIS was your game.

Let's compare that to 15 minutes into a season 8 game.

https://imgur.com/a/q84aaUJ

Notice the item bloat?

https://youtu.be/IWz5aA7DaiM?t=1241

It only gets worse when you take in the new tower plating. 15 minutes in I've seen 2/1/0 ADC's sitting on 2 completed items.

Let's not forget that 3 items on a champ is when they go from mid game to late game. Mid game now lasts 4-6 minutes total.

I mean all of this is ignoring the gutting of level 1-13 defensive stats, the adding of high damage keystones which didn't use to exist, and the inclusion of 10 different forms of armor pen that didn't exist before... ect.

All of this leads up to why we get these boring triple tank into triple tank pro games these days. No single tank is ever going to hold up to 4 2-3 item champs for more than a couple seconds. So to play safely they run a crap ton of front line. Ironically damage being out of hand is WHY we see tank meta pro games.

Also note that your typical ranged pokey type mages don't really see play anymore. Why? Because they are mid game monsters. There is no mid game.

replies.body: Been saying it forever: more damage in the game causes pro players to NOT fight even MORE than before. By increasing damage in the game, it's not going to cause any action, only more stagnation. Why is that so oblivious to Riot is beyond me.
Then they add more mobility and knockups forcing people to play safer as one cc ability for a hyper-mobile champion is game over
But...the current meta for pro play is ultra snowball and full agro, it already happens and yes, more dmg makes them fight more.

Makes them fight more? Before the games had 30+ kills. Now it is 4-10 kills. They are too scared to fight. One mistake and you die. Even pro players say that this is bullshit meta.

I remember how fun it was to watch Pro play. Origen making backdoor tactics. Teamfights lasting for a long time. Everybody had chance to shine and show some plays. Now they are doing basic combos and killing people without even outplaying them. 

Now pro matches are 0:0 or 1:1 for a long time. They end 8:1 or 6:4. The only entertaining thing is watching how Froggen farms. 14:4 from this vid is like a holiday. 

The old League was more action packed. People weren't scared to go in. They were doing outplays. They were learning how to do combos. Now Riven players don't have to auto cancel, they just fucking go at ya with conqueror. Lee Sin players don't need to insec, they just r + q oneshot you. There is literally less skill in the game than before.

???

games in pro end at 22 min right now, are we watching the same game?

The same. It is 22 min of doing nothing and gaining nothing. I can't understand how anybody can enjoy that, if they watched pro play in previous seasons. The quality of pro play deteriorated and I can't enjoy watching it anymore.
Okay you are not watching Kespa Cup or Demacia Cup, it's worthless to talk with you about pro play. no offense.
You mean those games that were one sided? You enjoy that?
you actually make a good point, but it doesn't explain damage late game though, when everyone DOES get their items.

> [{quoted}](name=SnackerMore,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-28T21:15:13.904+0000)
>
> you actually make a good point, but it doesn't explain damage late game though, when everyone DOES get their items.

Well the thing you have to remember. Is season 1 and 2 is was extremely rare to see a full build champion unless the game was pushing an hour or more. Some games did that, I remember having a game go almost an hour and a half.

Because mid game is so blasted short now you have this weird  bipolar meta where it's either 1-2 high dps (high to the point where it's basically burst as well) champs with 3-4 tanky front liners. Or you have 2-3 assassins/divers + some sort of drain tanking anti tank or a Varus/Vayne/Kaisa to finish up the tanks.

So you basically only have 3 matchups.  Divers vs DIvers. Tanks vs Tanks. Or Tanks vs divers. It's a pretty boring meta that doesn't seem to include traditional supports, poke mages, or Brusiers/Juggernauts.

> [{quoted}](name=SnackerMore,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-28T21:15:13.904+0000)
>
> you actually make a good point, but it doesn't explain damage late game though, when everyone DOES get their items.

"Late Game" inherently explains itself. When that period of the game is reached most champions/players have reached their power limit and plateau. Now that varies depending on gold from CS/Kills/Assist etc but even in late game if you're playing Jax/Vayne, for example, you can smash because the game is more skill dependent rather than item dependent like in the early game. If a Sion gets ahead early good luck trying to get a kill, he'll have corrupting pot, armor/health to block your damage and return it. Say if Vayne gets to 5 items though or even 4 items then that Sion is toast because she has the ability to kite and deal true damage, that is, if she knows how to play vayne. 

It's not that damage which is too high it is the overall skill of players which has gotten better along with early items. Players over the years have gotten far better. Look at season 1 CS vs season 8 CS. What Riot needs to implement is more diverse item options, not cut damage across the board. Riot has always been cautious of adding too many items because of confusing build paths and it can overwhelm the player. I personally think that's a poor excuse. Items are largely stagnant and Riot tunneling build paths so you only need to buy 1-2 pieces of an item is what allows champions to be so strong.

Runes and Keystones have always been hard to balance and this new system which was just updated makes it much worse. Tank/Bruisers become too strong as we see with Sion/Maokai/Darius when defensive items/runes are buffed(Not Maokai now but you should have seen him pre-update) or we see the burst from LB/Syndra/Caitlyn/Lucian when they are weak.

> [{quoted}](name=HadesBlades,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-12-28T21:44:59.600+0000)
>
> "Late Game" inherently explains itself. When that period of the game is reached most champions/players have reached their power limit and plateau. Now that varies depending on gold from CS/Kills/Assist etc but even in late game if you're playing Jax/Vayne, for example, you can smash because the game is more skill dependent rather than item dependent like in the early game. If a Sion gets ahead early good luck trying to get a kill, he'll have corrupting pot, armor/health to block your damage and return it. Say if Vayne gets to 5 items though or even 4 items then that Sion is toast because she has the ability to kite and deal true damage, that is, if she knows how to play vayne. 
> 
> It's not that damage which is too high it is the overall skill of players which has gotten better along with early items. Players over the years have gotten far better. Look at season 1 CS vs season 8 CS. What Riot needs to implement is more diverse item options, not cut damage across the board. Riot has always been cautious of adding too many items because of confusing build paths and it can overwhelm the player. I personally think that's a poor excuse. Items are largely stagnant and Riot tunneling build paths so you only need to buy 1-2 pieces of an item is what allows champions to be so strong.
> 
> Runes and Keystones have always been hard to balance and this new system which was just updated makes it much worse. Tank/Bruisers become too strong as we see with Sion/Maokai/Darius when defensive items/runes are buffed(Not Maokai now but you should have seen him pre-update) or we see the burst from LB/Syndra/Caitlyn/Lucian when they are weak.

It isn't so much that people have gotten better at CS'ing... it's that CS'ing has gotten MUCH easier. Last hit insurance... less Lag from better PC's. Minions that follow set patterns much better. Better/faster auto attack animations. Easier to target hitboxes for auto attacks. Also more gold early = more ad/ap = easier cs'ing... which means more gold...

If you actually look at it also there is only about a 25 cs difference at 15 minutes. THat what 500-600g? A full item up that does not make.

Again is still just gold bloat. Take the same game we have now. Reduce all sources of gold income by 30-40%. And you have a better/more strategic game with many more viable champions.

Let's not forget one very important fact. DPS champions get damage items faster than they get base defensive stats from levels. Thus squishies pop squishies much faster. 

Level 9 Squishy with pickaxe+boots+doran's blade vs Level 9 squishy with Sheen + boots is a MUCH slower fight than 2 level 9's with Stormrazor + zeal and Manamune + sheen.

Duskblade for example wouldn't be such an issue if bot lane was level 9 or 10 by the time mid could afford to buy it. Having some Zed roam down before you even hit 6 with a duskblade is the issue.
i miss season 4 and season 5 bro things where balanced those days.im still waiting riot to bring back season 5 this is the only reason i am still playing this game.

Yes, bring back the days when supports were walking around as a walking ward so the player base doesn't want to play it again and literally say mid or feed when they get the role.

Stop suggesting lowering support income, you are literally saying one person on each team is the team's bitch. I been a support main since season 2, no way do I want to go back to being half a player.

Support Mains never felt like walking wards. We had impact on the performance of our TEAM. We were focused on supporting our TEAM. We had skills and abilities that healed, amplified, and protected or TEAM. 

People "found it boring" that they weren't running around getting kills. That's it. They didn't see the importance of anything but personal stats.

You may like it but the queue time speaks for itselfs and only a little part of the playerbase wanted to play that kind of supp, hell the friend that now is my supp premade was a toplane main back in the days because he hated being as powerless as supps were. And no, he isn't a mage supp type, he mains champs like Braum or Taric.

Yeah five seconds q time for top and 3 minutes for support, mid, jungle. 

Supports are better carries than toplaners. And for what? So low elo can do big playZ dmg and 1v5 teams. Great. Why provide vision, healing, peel, shielding when you can just 1v5 times for the high skill of sitting botlane not having to farm, matchup knowledge, mechanics or any laning skill at all. 

Supports were never powerless back then.
Something that never fails to amaze me it's the victim complex of toplaners.

toplaners had the rights to be salty before 8.11, but now you can actually pick a carry and do something. Most of complaining toplaners are the guys who usually stay under turret and wait for ganks anyway
Yeah but the one complaining plays carry toplaners when he plays and still cries about the meta right now.
Never said that it was ever POPULAR lol. I see it like Clerics and Priests in most game. A few that love it, and most of a game who can't stand playing it.

Well... that's the point. League requires to have 20% of players in each game to play support. If only idk, 3% of playerbase enjoy playing support then amount of dodges and trolls will be bigger than amount of quality games. Supports got changed for better. Game is healthier with them being more than ward bitches

Indeed! I don't disagree with that at all.  The problem has become that, while I wasn't a fan of the Censer Meta either, actual supports have been stuffed in the background - all because people fear the return of basically one item - and therefore the entire role is being replaced by mages.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a00020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-29T11:57:21.951+0000)
>
> Indeed! I don't disagree with that at all.  The problem has become that, while I wasn't a fan of the Censer Meta either, actual supports have been stuffed in the background - all because people fear the return of basically one item - and therefore the entire role is being replaced by mages.

...but tank supports are the pro meta, not mage supports. Tank supports have been the high elo meta ALL YEAR and it hasn't changed since. Why do you guys constantly blame mages when Braum and Kench have been top dog supports for 365 days in the high elo/competitive space?

Mage supps are not meta since S6 and early S7, since mid S7 till now mage supps have never been meta on pro play.

And its also worth to say that enchanters in the last years have literally only been been meta on the Ardent meta, tanks and catchers just offer so much more on coordinated play. That's basically why I dont mind enchanters having high winrate on soloQ, because I know that they are not really strong.

> [{quoted}](name=saltran,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-29T22:27:40.976+0000)
>
> Mage supps are not meta since S6 and early S7, since mid S7 till now mage supps have never been meta on pro play.
> 
> And its also worth to say that enchanters in the last years have literally only been been meta on the Ardent meta, tanks and catchers just offer so much more on coordinated play. That's basically why I dont mind enchanters having high winrate on soloQ, because I know that they are not really strong.

Well...let's put this into perspective:

Janna was good for a few years, since I got here in season 5. There might have been stints where they gravitated away from her, but she was generally good for a mad minute.

Lulu was good in pro play for her solo lane and her supporting.

Karma was a strong pro play support until they gutted her shield one last time when they added Athene's.

Soraka was good for a bit in season 6 when they removed Grevious Wounds. Then she was garbage again when they put it back.

Zilean's always been a decent pick for the right times in pro play since I got here in preseason 5...but in mid lane, not bot lane.

Sona's been garbage and I've never seen a time where she wasn't.

Not super sure on Nami. I think she had a stint where she was picked a bit in season 6?

The issue with enchanters is that their counter-play is just non-existent a lot of the time. You can play around tank/catcher supports. Enchanters usually have to be manually removed from the meta to stop being oppressive, then manually pushed back in to be relevant again.

The game is literally the opposite of healthy now that supports are carries. 

Like do you play this game? Supports are FAR from healthy and the game suffers for it.

Supports are carries only in your mind lol

I play this game, i play every role outside of ADC, and i have fun with everything. Every role have a carry potential now, and that's good. If you're losing to "carry supports" it just means that you're a worse player than said support. And there's nothing wrong with that.

And game is one of the best states ever if you would ask me. Diverse meta, no slugfest games, i'll take this meta over any s5-s7 meta any day.

>I play this game, i play every role outside of ADC, and i have fun with everything.

Next time we play I want you to play ADC and I support you.
nono, im not touching ADCs, you can't force me to do that
Cmon you just need to rightclick a few times, it cant be hard right ?
im not skilled enough to do these sick vayne outplays, i'd rather play Ali and outplay you with my superior and hard to pull off combo
You can play Ezreal if you are not skilled enough to rightclick

> [{quoted}](name=LTK KoRo,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a000200000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-12-29T19:27:55.529+0000)
>
> Supports are carries only in your mind lol
> 
> I play this game, i play every role outside of ADC, and i have fun with everything. Every role have a carry potential now, and that's good. If you're losing to "carry supports" it just means that you're a worse player than said support. And there's nothing wrong with that.
> 
> And game is one of the best states ever if you would ask me. Diverse meta, no slugfest games, i'll take this meta over any s5-s7 meta any day.

I'm not talking about s5+ I'm talking about the period I consider the game at it's best. Season 1 and 2.

> [{quoted}](name=LTK KoRo,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-29T11:53:06.936+0000)
>
> Well... that's the point. League requires to have 20% of players in each game to play support. If only idk, 3% of playerbase enjoy playing support then amount of dodges and trolls will be bigger than amount of quality games. Supports got changed for better. Game is healthier with them being more than ward bitches

Actually it's more of a money making scheme. Make the game appeal to MORE players. Not quality players. The game was just about damn troll free for the first couple of seasons. People also were generally respectful and had to communicate to decide who was going to what position.

> [{quoted}](name=saltran,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a00020000,timestamp=2018-12-29T11:04:54.668+0000)
>
> You may like it but the queue time speaks for itselfs and only a little part of the playerbase wanted to play that kind of supp, hell the friend that now is my supp premade was a toplane main back in the days because he hated being as powerless as supps were. And no, he isn't a mage supp type, he mains champs like Braum or Taric.

Season 1 and 2 queue times were only about 40 seconds long FYI.

> [{quoted}](name=MorgManBasher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-12-29T03:12:44.515+0000)
>
> Yes, bring back the days when supports were walking around as a walking ward so the player base doesn't want to play it again and literally say mid or feed when they get the role.
> 
> Stop suggesting lowering support income, you are literally saying one person on each team is the team's bitch. I been a support main since season 2, no way do I want to go back to being half a player.

Agreed. These people think that supports are an issue because we get to actually make itemization decisions now. No Nami on a Censer and an Athene's is a damage threat. These people need to stop blaming the entire role because of Brand and Zyra.

> [{quoted}](name=MorgManBasher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-12-29T03:12:44.515+0000)
>
> Yes, bring back the days when supports were walking around as a walking ward so the player base doesn't want to play it again and literally say mid or feed when they get the role.
> 
> Stop suggesting lowering support income, you are literally saying one person on each team is the team's bitch. I been a support main since season 2, no way do I want to go back to being half a player.

I loved supporting in season one and two. You actually felt like a support. It was a ton of fun trying to accomplish as much as you could with the limited funds you had. Also your vision game was MASSIVELY stronger.

At least in solo queue 90% of supports are just mid mage mains on their off role working with 70-80% of the income they'd have in a solo lane. They don't even feel like supports.

I'm also not saying all changes have been bad. I'm fine with spreading the gold around more than in season 1 and 2. What I'm utterly against is how fast carry vs carry fights resolve. This in entirely due to items being handed out before base stats are there to prevent the "one shot." Take the game we have now... globally lower all forms of income by around 30% and you have a much more strategic game. At it stands league plays more like a bullet hell than a MOBA. The first non tank to not dodge a CC dies instantly. Again this is due to carries getting items sooo much faster than they used to. 

Even if you just look at gold totals there is 5-6k gap on gold earned. If you do want to use the "people CS better" argument (which at best accounts for around 2k) then here is an idea. Because people CS better.... how about we lower the gold income from minions to compensate. IE raise the bar.
SUPPORT, you're not supposed to be a damage dealer lmao.
I've had ludens, oblivion orb, and sorc boots at 8 mins pretty consistently (in aram). The damage is very stupid that early

> [{quoted}](name=SpiritOfOdysseus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-12-29T01:25:46.705+0000)
>
> I've had ludens, oblivion orb, and sorc boots at 8 mins pretty consistently (in aram). The damage is very stupid that early

Yes, ARAM is relevant.
Yes, supports should go back to having 0 agency of the game. Great idea.

> [{quoted}](name=Snake of Avarice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-12-29T01:13:35.559+0000)
>
> Yes, supports should go back to having 0 agency of the game. Great idea.

I think what you really mean is that supports should go back to 'I used my entire kit and actually saved my teammate' and not 'wow I used one ability and my teammate died before I could use another.'.

Because I would love that.

> [{quoted}](name=Ranmaru Kurosaki,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-12-29T01:32:30.471+0000)
>
> I think what you really mean is that supports should go back to 'I used my entire kit and actually saved my teammate' and not 'wow I used one ability and my teammate died before I could use another.'.
> 
> Because I would love that.

I died in a game not long ago as adc where all a brand sup used was his R. 3 bounces, no other abilities hit. Started at full health. Guy had his t2 sup item Liandries and a ludens. A mid game "support" should not be able to afford 2 damage items.

I remember how once I got to full build with a Deathcap on Lux mid by the 26th or 28th minute. I was literally 1v5ing the enemy team because I was level 18 with Zhonya's, whereas they had barely reached 14 with little items. And on top of that I had Morello, Void Staff and Sorcery boots for magic pen. You can guess how stupid my damage and cooldowns were.

Back in Season 5 even (when I began) I doubt I would be able to achieve that. Maybe by 35th minute *at best*. Season 1 that would probably be impossible to do even before 45 minutes. That's with 20+ kills and same number of assists.

> [{quoted}](name=ExpStealer,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2018-12-29T10:15:03.643+0000)
>
> I remember how once I got to full build with a Deathcap on Lux mid by the 26th or 28th minute. I was literally 1v5ing the enemy team because I was level 18 with Zhonya's, whereas they had barely reached 14 with little items. And on top of that I had Morello, Void Staff and Sorcery boots for magic pen. You can guess how stupid my damage and cooldowns were.
> 
> Back in Season 5 even (when I began) I doubt I would be able to achieve that. Maybe by 35th minute *at best*. 

1) You can't draw conclusions about a game state you weren't even apart of.

2) You wouldn't have been able to get fed and snowball in season 5 **because you weren't that good in season 5.** Skill plays a major role in all of this. Why the hell does Irelia have 2 Null-Mantles and a Chalice and a Phage? Why does Corki have three Doran's Blades? Because they aren't as good at the game in that time to know that they just gold sink'd themselves for no reason when they should be working on completing items. No one would do something so asinine in today's League because everyone knows that it's almost always better to complete items than it is to buy the parts.

This thread is heavily misleading.

It isn't, because *now* I have the experience. You're just saying that a Season 1 veteran can't speak about season 1 because they weren't good back then. Can they not reflect upon their past experiences with their current knowledge?

Also, did you just call professional players noobs, who don't know what they're building?

> [{quoted}](name=ExpStealer,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OaNAYNAo,comment-id=000c00000000,timestamp=2018-12-29T20:40:50.906+0000)
>
> It isn't, because *now* I have the experience. You're just saying that a Season 1 veteran can't speak about season 1 because they weren't good back then. Can they not reflect upon their past experiences with their current knowledge?

You said you started in like season 5. You're not a season 1 veteran if you started in the season I started in, so why are you giving commentary on what's possible in season 1?
 
> Also, did you just call professional players noobs, who don't know what they're building?

In season 1, EVERYONE WAS A NOOB. It's super easy to jump on a new scene and flex like you're good when no one knows what they're doing. The general skill level of the *entire community* has increased greatly since back then. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSHvzZy1YZA

Perfect example

Aphromoo's talking about how easy supporting is. Meanwhile, his opposing Corki's walking into melee range of a Leona and he's Flash auto'ing a minion. The enemy plays the whole thing from start to finish like a bunch of bronzies...but this is **Aphromoo** we're talking about. There's no way he's in a bronze game, but his enemy plays like some bronze/iron elo shit.

League is a decade old. The skill floor is higher than Season 1. It's the same for any older competitive scene. Longer it lasts, harder it is.
That clip is legendary, but I think he was high there.
